While both play important roles in society, intertwining the two can lead to division, discrimination, and the imposition of beliefs on individuals who may not share them. A government should remain neutral in matters of religion to ensure equal treatment for all citizens. By keeping politics and religion separate, we can create a more inclusive and tolerant society where individuals are free to practice their own faith without interference.
